Name: Nelson Mandela
Description: Anti-apartheid revolutionary and former President of South Africa.

Name: Albert Einstein
Description: Theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity.

Name: Frida Kahlo
Description: Iconic Mexican artist known for her surreal self-portraits.

Name: Malala Yousafzai
Description: Nobel Prize laureate and activist for girls' education.

Name: Leonardo da Vinci
Description: Renaissance genius known for art, science, and invention.

Name: Rosa Parks
Description: Civil rights activist known for the Montgomery Bus Boycott.

Name: Amelia Earhart
Description: Aviation pioneer and first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic.

Name: Mahatma Gandhi
Description: Leader of the Indian independence movement through non-violent civil disobedience.

Name: Katherine Johnson
Description: NASA mathematician whose calculations helped land astronauts on the moon.

Name: Helen Keller
Description: Author and activist who overcame the challenges of being deaf and blind.

Name: Steve Jobs
Description: Visionary entrepreneur and co-founder of Apple Inc.

Name: Jane Goodall
Description: Primatologist known for her groundbreaking work with chimpanzees.
